adventure_overview: In this Adventure, Tigers will explore the different food groups, have fun being active, and the importance of rest. Prior to any activity, use Scouting America SAFE Checklist to ensure the safety of all those involved. All participants in official Scouting America activities should become familiar with the Guide to Safe Scouting and applicable program literature or manuals.

activities.name: Food Group Tiger Relay
activities.description: Relay race to  identify  food items and the food group they belong to.

activities.name: My Favorite Foods
activities.description: Cub Scouts draw their favorite food for each of the five good groups.

activities.name: My Favorite Snack
activities.description: Cub Scouts bring and share their favorite food from one of the five food groups.

requirements.text: Practice hand washing. Point out when you should wash your hands.

activities.name: Scout Oath and Law Hand Washing
activities.description: Proper handwashing and learning how long it takes to do a good  job.

requirements.text: Practice methods that help you sleep.

activities.name: Tiger Get Ready for Bed
activities.description: Make a bedtime routine to help get enough sleep using the activity in the Tiger  handbook .

activities.name: Tiger Time to Sleep
activities.description: Cub Scouts with their parent or legal guardian  establish  a good  bedtime.
